# Diecut Documentation

> A project template generator written in Rust (like cookiecutter, but in Rust)

## Overview

Diecut is a fast, Rust-based CLI tool for generating projects from templates. It supports GitHub repositories, local templates, and multi-template repos with subpaths.

## Getting Started

- Installation & Quick Start: https://diecut.dev/getting-started/

## Guides

- Using Templates: https://diecut.dev/using-templates/
- Creating Templates: https://diecut.dev/creating-templates/

## Reference

- Commands: https://diecut.dev/reference/commands/
- diecut.toml: https://diecut.dev/reference/diecut-toml/
- Hooks: https://diecut.dev/reference/hooks/

## Quick Examples

```bash
# Generate from a GitHub repo (with subpath for multi-template repos)
diecut new gh:raiderrobert/diecut-templates/rust-cli --output my-project

# Use defaults without prompting
diecut new gh:raiderrobert/diecut-templates/python-pkg --defaults --output my-project

# Generate from a local template
diecut new ./my-template --output my-project

# List cached templates
diecut list
```

## Installation

```bash
curl -fsSL https://diecut.dev/install.sh | sh
```

Or via cargo:
```bash
cargo install diecut
```

## Key Features

- Fast Rust-based template generation
- GitHub repository support with subpath navigation
- Local and remote template sources
- Template caching for offline use
- Post-creation hooks for automation
- Minijinja templating engine
